website_summaries.verdict: Low maintenance and effective fogless mirror with locking suction.
pros: With a simple splash of hot water, will stay fogless for the duration
With strong suction and a 45-degree tilt, this mirror is ideal for more than 1 person who uses the shower
cons: Needs a very smooth surface to stick to
Mirror can still be hazy in the shower

customer_reviews.title: Worked Initially, then Not So Much
customer_reviews.text: When I initially purchased this mirror it worked absolutely great. As advertised, no fog! Unfortunately as time has gone on the mirror's performance has significantly diminished. I eventually had to wipe it off every few seconds before it would again begin to fog up. Then a film began to take over the mirror's surface, making it impossible to even see yourself. The film will not even come off with vigorous scrubbing. It was nice while it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Groesbeck

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: In no way is this a no fog mirror. I put it up in my shower and can never use it because it is always fogged up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Is not fog free
customer_reviews.text: My husband has had this mirror for 3 years. Afetr the first 40 days or so, it has never stayed up, and it always fogged up. It's not a real mirror either. It's like reflective foil, which makes it less heavy, but it still did not stay up. I would have returned it except it stopped staying up after the 30 day return period.
customer_reviews.author: NatH

customer_reviews.title: Save your money, do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product on May 15th 2017, started using it about May 17th 2017, and by June 4th 2017, it fogs up constantly. The instructions said that over time the fog coating will wear off and just wipe the mirror with a soapy hand (I'm paraphrasing a bit). First, I didn't expect the mirror to start fogging in a matter of weeks. Second, it's pretty tough to shave with a wet mirror, so that solution is terrible. I realize I am committing a slight offense by posting a negative review, when I rarely write reviews, but I hope that I can save at least one person their money, and the trouble installing this terrible fogging mirror.
customer_reviews.author: TB

customer_reviews.title: It only just now broke after 3 years
customer_reviews.text: It broke at the part that holds onto the suction cup so i imagine if mine hadn't been taken off so many times and put back up it would have lasted a long time. It does fog up really easily so you might want rain-x or something. The twisting action to pull the suction cup tighter did not seem to work well, and it was not very easy to press the suction cup on enough so that it would stay, even after tightening by twisting the base.
customer_reviews.author: Trenton Moody

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 4 months - not fogless
customer_reviews.text: Became progressively more foggy over time. splashing with water made it temporarily better, but fogless it is not. It was still clear enough for shaving, but one day it popped off the wall and the mechanism for attaching it was broken. Lasted just over 4 months - not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bubb

customer_reviews.title: I've had much better luck with shower accessories with adhesive backing than suction ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used this mirror for two years and it's biggest downfall is that it will eventually fall off your shower wall, no matter how well it's secured. That's the limit of suction cups. It could be a couple months before it happens, but eventually you hear a crash noise and wonder where it came from, only to realize that it's the shower mirror--again. At this very moment, I'm buying the only other no fog shower mirror that's rated slightly higher than this one, the one from ToiletTree that has an adhesive backing. I've had much better luck with shower accessories with adhesive backing than suction cups. Maybe Upper West Collection will update this model with an adhesive instead?
customer_reviews.author: RAL

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: After a year and a half in my shower, mine broke at the part where the suction cup attaches to the mirror. It sort of did its job before it broke. It's definitely not "fog free," although splashing some water on it when it's foggy keeps the mirror fairly usable, although the image in the mirror is never really clear or distortion-free. The suction was okay at best; the mirror tended to fall off the wall every few weeks. A final (minor) complaint is the ugly "Upper West" logo on the back of the mirror, which thankfully is not really visible when the mirror is mounted.
customer_reviews.author: beaf

customer_reviews.title: Easy to mount. No fog! Finally.
customer_reviews.text: Updated Review: After having this mirror for some time I am downgraded my rating for several reasons: 1. After the first few months the mirror became impossible to clean and did not remain fog free. It has spots and I believe the mirror surface has degraded. 2. Ever so often I hear and crash and it turns out to be the mirror falling off the wall. Bottom line, I no longer recommend this mirror| Previous Review: This is by far a much better mirror then the simplehuman no fog mirror. It mounted easily, using suction, with no sticky stuff that is hard to remove. It's easily movable. And it hasn't fogged on me at all!
customer_reviews.author: Dan B

customer_reviews.title: Quality mirror
customer_reviews.text: I have used a number of fog less mirrors in the past and they all fall apart over time. Usually the mirror becomes cloudy and in our last one the plastic mirror fell out and the suction cups stopped doing their job. So far (6 months) this works great. Having the ability to angle adjust is nice. It does stick out so you should make sure to put it in a spot where you won’t hit it while showering or drying off. I wish that it came withal razor holder for 2 razors but not a dealbreaker.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No fog at 1st week of use. Now it's foggy every use
customer_reviews.text: No fog at 1st week of use. Now it's foggy every use during a somewhat steamy shower to heavy steam shower. Not sure what I have to do to get back how it worked the 1st few days. Must be some type of coating? Only thing I can think of. What saves this from being less than 3 stars is the fact that I can trim my beard in the shower (before turning it on) and works perfectly. Mounted very nicely and is VERY strong, has not fallen yet.
customer_reviews.author: 71Chevelle502

customer_reviews.title: Would not adhere to shower wall
customer_reviews.text: I have a porcelain tile in my shower. The product description states that this mirror will adhere to that type of surface. But it just kept falling off during numerous attempts. So, I used the enclosed disc and glue. I used all the glue provided and after 2 days of not using that shower to give the glue and disc time to dry, I placed the mirror on the disc and mirror and disc came crashing down. Going to try to return.
customer_reviews.author: David U.

customer_reviews.title: Still anti-fog and holding on
customer_reviews.text: Three weeks in, still holding up with thr anti-fog. Great design with one suction cup versus 3-4, which cross grout lines. Haven't wiped the mirror with anything, no need to. Doesn't get very wet due to placement, so don't know if thats a factor. I just know my pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Jason spreman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Mirror
customer_reviews.text: It's been stuck to my bathroom tile since I got it. Use a little bit of aquaphor on the suction cup and it sticks perfectly. As for no fog: mine works just fine. Per the instructions you can run your soapy hand over it and that keeps it fog free. Also I dropped it while I was installing (my own clumsy fault) and it didn't break. So 5 stars for that too.
customer_reviews.author: BetaJim

customer_reviews.title: Not fog-free for long
customer_reviews.text: I mounted this mirror in the shower and it remained fogless for a few days. Then, it fogs up like any other mirror. Still, it's great for shaving in the shower; you just have to splash water on it periodically to clear it. The adhesion to the shower wall is exceptional.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh Mateas

customer_reviews.title: Worked once then fogged up
customer_reviews.text: My wife complained that my hair would get everywhere when I shaved. I decided to start shaving in the shower and naturally needed a mirror. I found this one and gave it a try. The first time I used it things were fine and it did not fog at all. The next time though, it fogged up quickly. If I want to shave I have to use it very quickly or I have to take an ice shower it seems.
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: Not so fogless
customer_reviews.text: Sticks to the wall as described and it's one of the best suction locking mechanisms on the market how ever the mirror it self fogs up just like a regular mirror if you ask me....it asks to hold the mirror close to hot water for a "few minutes" well let me tell you...I'm done with my shower before the mirror begins to defog...the only solution is to soak the mirrior with hot water as you shower and you will have to do it multiple times because mirrior starts to fog up again-i gave 2 stars only because i like the suction locking and stickyness to the wall part of this product no other reason.
customer_reviews.author: Greg S.

customer_reviews.title: Good Mirror
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item a year ago now and it still works great. It has not lost its anti-fog properties as others have indicated. Just follow the cleaning instructions to ensure you do not remove the anti-fog film/layer or whatever it is. :)
customer_reviews.author: Jose Antonio Bueno Roca

customer_reviews.title: Not fog free at all
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not fog free. Fogged up in first shower. Easy enough to wipe off though. Design is ok. My biggest issue though is that it apparently has some sort of protective film on it that is wearing off and now my mirror looks blurry in spots even when it’s dry. You can run your finger across the mirror and feel it.
customer_reviews.author: Zerauskire

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: This is a superior product. I have owned three or four no-fog shower mirrors over the years: this one is the best by far. I love it! Locking the mirror in place in my shower was a breeze. It took, literally, 10 seconds. The mirror has remained firmly in place ever since. I read a few reviews where users could not get it to hold. Their shower tile is probably porous, or they are simply trying to press the mirror into place rather than pressing and then turning the locking mechanism. I highly recommend this mirror.
customer_reviews.author: RJGatorEsq.

customer_reviews.title: Oh, there will most certainly be fog...
customer_reviews.text: To date, I have yet to find a shower mirror that truly resists any condensation from forming on its surface. And this one falls into that category as well. In the first few weeks, it did a decent enough job at making the mirror still somewhat clear, but there was definitely still "fog" on the lens. After a few months, it may as well had not even been there because you couldn't see anything out of it. Again, my biggest gripe with this is that they advertise it as "No Fog" shower mirror, when it most definitely fogs up and is almost useless within a few months
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is only fogless temporarily. After about a month it became foggy like a regular mirror. The instructions received with the product state: "The treatment that makes mirrors prevent fog will eventually fade" and suggests wiping a soapy hand on the mirror to have "fog free protection for the rest of your shower" - which is just like a regular mirror.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Fogless Mirror
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I have gotten. Easy to install on smooth surface and is very secure. Mirror swivels to fit the user's size. Mirror will start to fog after a few weeks, but is not a problem and is stated in sellers description. Just rub a little soapy water with your hand or washcloth, and it clears right up for use. I will buy again for another location.
customer_reviews.author: bossman

customer_reviews.title: Fogs and Falls: Big Fail
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of having a mirror handing in the shower. The idea of it is the only pro I could conjure with this product. Here are the cons. (1) The suction on this mirror is not strong enough to hold it up, no matter what preparation or technique is employed, including prayer and wishful thinking. (2) The mirror fogs up, not completely but enough to distort your image.
customer_reviews.author: Espanolish

customer_reviews.title: RV sink lid mirror
customer_reviews.text: I have a flip up lid on my sink in my RV. What I do is stick this mirror on the bottom of the sink lid and when I use the sink it just pops up and I can veiw for shaving, etc.. I've been using this for a couple of months. It has not fallen off and I have not had ti readjust.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Great Mirror For In-Shower Shavers - Mirror Mount Won't Come Loose On Its Own.
customer_reviews.text: As others have already mentioned, finding a fog-free in-shower mirror is hit and miss; 99% miss. This is my second purchase and the newer one is slightly larger than the one from last year, a delightful plus. The suction cup mount is fabulous. My original one never came loose by itself...ever. Now a caution!!! DO NOT use Rain-X or other anti-fogulants (just made up that word). It wrecked the entire surface of my original mirror, thus the need for a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Cap Capello

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shower mirror!!
customer_reviews.text: If you place it on a smooth surface and clean the area well (I use alcohol), it attaches securely. I like that the mirror can be adjusted for shorter/taller people. My husband loved it because it didn't fog! Just purchased, however; so time will tell. Update Dec 2016....Just purchased second mirror and they are the best shower mirrors we've ever had! Very well made...quality product. They are more expensive, but you get what you pay for! You will not regret purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: 8banana

customer_reviews.title: Nice Mirror for Shower
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a mirror for my husband to use in the shower, and it arrived in good time. So far, my husband is very happy with it. It doesn't seem to "fog up" like another one I bought for him earlier (different brand), which I ended up throwing out! I'm hopeful that this one will remain "fogless" and work very well for him.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution - just buy it
customer_reviews.text: I have always shaved over the sink, and cut my own hair in the shower (I just buzz it short with a #1 clipper). I'd get out of the shower, notice I had missed a few spots, and get back in to finish. How stupid is that? It took me a few years of stupidity before I challenged this process, and this was an easy solution. The mirror mounts easy, does not fog up, and works perfectly. A side effect is the sink is now clean of any hair or shaving gunk, and it's just so much easier to do that in the shower.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Fog Free - works great
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this now for 3 weeks and it works great. Simply wipe it with soapy water and rinse it - i stays fog free. The suction for the mirror is very strong, and easy to install. The razor holder is a great addition. This is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Steven G.

customer_reviews.title: Not entirely Fog Free
customer_reviews.text: Had this mirror for exactly one week. The first few days of use, it didn't fog at all. But after day 4 or 5 of using, it fogged up completely. It becomes mostly fog free again when you splash water on it and it lasts about 5-7 minutes before it starts fogging up again. But the whole point of this thing is to stay fog free throughout the whole shower right? Regardless, it's okay. It's certainly not perfect but it does the job... after a little bit of effort on your part.
customer_reviews.author: philpe30

customer_reviews.title: He says it is so much better to shave in the shower than after getting out ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift for my husband, and he loves it. He says it is so much better to shave in the shower than after getting out of the shower because 1) his beard is softer because it is fully wet and warm 2) the cleanup is easy since stubble and shaving cream immediately wash down the drain. Some reviews complained that the mirror was not fully fog free. Perhaps that is the case for them, but not for my husband. He is very pleased. The only con I see for this product is that I think it is a little pricey.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy in Kentucky

customer_reviews.title: The design of mirror is great. I don't fault the design at all
customer_reviews.text: The mirror falls off my shower wall after 15 to 30 minutes. My shower walls have quartz tile but it is not completely smooth. The mirror hangs on more than long enough for me to finish my shower and shaving. The only downside is that it falls off if I forget to take it off. It scares the crud out of me when I'm sleeping and it comes down!!!! The design of mirror is great. I don't fault the design at all, it's my tile. I do believe that it is probably the best mirror of its kind and I have every intension to continue using it.
customer_reviews.author: IndyDave

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT stick
customer_reviews.text: I have been meaning to write this review for a while because I personally count on reviews to help me make decisions about products. I was so disappointed in this mirror, as it will not adhere to the shower for more than 5 minutes. We followed the directions to the letter and tried multiple times and every single time, it falls within a 5 minute period. I hate wasting money so have not thrown it away but truly it is useless without hanging capability. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Less than a year later and this thing is broken ...
customer_reviews.text: Less than a year later and this thing is broken. First, it fell off the shower wall several times even though I have a smooth wall. And then, the most recent time the inside plastic cylinder attaching the suction device to the mirror degraded from i suppose steam from the shower and just broke. If this is supposed to be for use in the shower, why use such a cheap part that will fail? Won't be buying from these folks again. 27.99 to rent this thing for 11 months. No thanks.
customer_reviews.author: I. Barragan

customer_reviews.title: It works very well
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this mirror for the second time. Got about 2 years out of the first one. (The anti-fog surface doesn't last forever). The suction mounting system is outstanding; trouble free and seemingly lasts forever, never failed once. This is an excellent shower mirror.
customer_reviews.author: DJ Fox

customer_reviews.title: 5 star quality and 5 star customer service
customer_reviews.text: This arrived quickly, attaches with such ease, so long as I find that one spot with minimal texture on my shower wall (textured tiles), and it (wait for it) DOESN'T FOG UP. I love this mirror, it rotates with relative ease and the bonus razor holder was the cherry on top. I also love that this vendor has taken the time to ensure the proper functionality of their product post purchase. A must have for any guy that takes their grooming seriously
customer_reviews.author: Toys Toys Toys

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: Does not stay stuck the the tile no matter what. No instructions came with it. There was a tube of blue and a plastic thing that i assumed you glue on the tile but it does not stay. i have left it days and it just falls off.
customer_reviews.author: T.York

customer_reviews.title: Works as expect - if you read the directions.
customer_reviews.text: I take really hot showers and, yes it will fog up if you put it on the wall with the shower head and the water is really hot, BUT it takes only a couple of seconds to clear it. Splash some hot water on it - NO FOG. It's in the directions. Very clear mirror and the swivel feature is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Tad

customer_reviews.title: Good solid product, not fog free
customer_reviews.text: 3.5 stars if I could. Pros - This is a high quality product - solid mirror, solid suction and base - works well on my smooth surface shower. Cons - This is not fog free -never was - I actually don't think fog free mirrors for the shower really exist. Leaving this as 3 stars solely because it's advertised as fog free but that is not the case. Works well if you splash water on it to warm it up a bit. Wish the actual mirror portion was easily detachable so you could warm it up to keep it fog free while shaving.
customer_reviews.author: MCPDX

customer_reviews.title: Great fog proof mirror
customer_reviews.text: I shave in the shower and this mirror is the best I have used so far. It has a bigger diameter than most others. The reflection is very clear and is been fog proof so far. I like that it will rotate so you can get the perfect shave. It is also easy to install
customer_reviews.author: j

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Is fog free, actually sticks to the spot that I placed it. Has stayed in place for over three weeks. Would but again & recommend to others looking for a quality shower mirror.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley

customer_reviews.title: It works wonderfully! It attaches easily and securely
customer_reviews.text: It works wonderfully! It attaches easily and securely. IT does not fog up, but if it does just spray the shower head on it to heat the glass up a bit. The razor holder on the other hand is a pain in the but to attach. I used rubbing alcohol to purify the surface and it still wouldn't stick. I eventually tried attaching it after my shower and it stuck and has held up without dropping for a week so far. I think the wall needed too be heated up for it to stick.
customer_reviews.author: Technical Engineer

customer_reviews.title: The invisible woman
customer_reviews.text: This mirror is not fog less. It attaches nicely to your shower wall but will be a huge disappointment when your shaving and can’t see your face all of the sudden
customer_reviews.author: Kimble

customer_reviews.title: Adjustability is great.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my ADHD son so he can visually inspect to make sure he got all of his hair wet and lathered. I love that you can rotate it. That makes it so much easier to adjust it to whatever angle you need. It's working well. I read a lot of reviews that complained about it not sticking to people's tile, but it sticks fine to my 4" square glazed ceramic tiles just fine. I've had it for a month and it hasn't fallen off yet.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy H.

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunate foggy mirror
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for myself, but only after a few uses the mirror started to fog up. In addition, the suction cup for the razor fell off and broke my razor. I had high hopes for this and really wanted it be a bathroom staple.
customer_reviews.author: Colton Ku

customer_reviews.title: This shower mirror is awesome! The new locking device on this completely locks ...
customer_reviews.text: This shower mirror is awesome! The new locking device on this completely locks this in place to our shower wall. We have no fear now of this falling off in the middle of the night and scaring us like others have done! It also has a real mirror that doesn't fog... not a film type. And, it tilts in any direction. A definite winner. Well worth the money! I watched the little video they recommended to watch and in a minute we had it up and working! Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy D.

customer_reviews.title: Fog Free - so far!
customer_reviews.text: It's a very nice design and appears to be of good quality. It was easy to install and the suction cup looks to be strong enough to hold it. I've only used it 2 times but it did not fog up at all! Very promising! The suction cup for the razor holder does not lock like the mirror and I doubt it will stay up but I don't really need it anyway. I like the way the suction cu for the mirror locks in place which seems like it will keep it from falling.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great Fogless Mirror!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this as a stocking stuffer for my husband and he loves it! He now can shave while he's in the shower, saving time (and no mess)! In order for it to no get foggy you have to run hot water over it and then poof it's clear for the rest of your shower. The suction for the morrie is also super strong!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Would not stay up long term
customer_reviews.text: Fell down after 3 months. Cannot get it to suction again. Purchased an additional mirror that also does not stick to the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. Update: not meeting expectations
customer_reviews.text: This is a great value and will last for many years. Very well made. Update: After a couple of months of use, my mirror is starting to fog. I don't know why because it has not been touched since installation. The product is well made, but is not meeting expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Hal A. Pena

customer_reviews.title: ... mirrors for a long time and never been very happy, throwing one away and getting a different one ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used fogless mirrors for a long time and never been very happy, throwing one away and getting a different one every six months. This fogless mirror looks to be the one I was looking ofr in the first place. It's high quality, attractive and works well! I recommend buying this mirrors over other fogless shower mirrors you may see for sale. You'll like it! Update: I liked it so much I bought a 2nd mirror for my motorhome!
customer_reviews.author: bschilz

customer_reviews.title: Stays on Wall
customer_reviews.text: The suction cup system on this shower mirror holds the mirror well. The anti-fog coating works well with very little care by following the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Amzie

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money Doesn't stay attached to shower wall
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money Doesn't stay attached to shower wall. I stuck it to the tile and also to the disc in the box. Held for couple of days then fell off. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The perfect no fog shower mirror.
customer_reviews.text: I've had a variety of frustrating shower mirrors, but this one really holds and is REALLY fogless. The manufacturer goes to great length (email, instructions) to help ensure you know how to maintain the foglessness. I don't think you can do much better in terms of shower mirrors. Note that it is actually pretty large, so you get a great view of your face.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua R

customer_reviews.title: I have no idea why this mirror has high reviews ...
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea why this mirror has high reviews. The frame is made of cheap plastic and the anti-fog stops working after a few days. I felt that I made too much for a cheap plastic mirror.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica B

customer_reviews.title: Definitely NOT fog free!
customer_reviews.text: I really hoped this would stay fog free, but it definitely doesn’t. It’s better looking than some other the others, but doesn’t live up to it’s name. I’m disappointed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Shay_526

customer_reviews.title: I got this for my husband's birthday and he was only able to use it a few times before it became completely useless. What a bumm
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could do less than 1 star. This mirror is not a "no fog" mirror. I got this for my husband's birthday and he was only able to use it a few times before it became completely useless. What a bummer. And a total waste of $30. I of course waited too long to look into returning it so looks like it'll just get tossed. Seriously, don't purchase this item.
customer_reviews.author: Mary West

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use
customer_reviews.text: It does stick out a bit far from the wall but my shower is big enough so doesn’t bother me. So far so good on suction power.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine L. Corrigan

customer_reviews.title: As a mirror it works fine but I have to put water on the glass ...
customer_reviews.text: Certainly NOT NO FOG......Unless there is some trick I am not aware of or showed up in the paperwork with the product....Oh wait.....No paperwork or warrantee documentation either.....Sorry. As a mirror it works fine but I have to put water on the glass to clear the fog every time. EVERY TIME.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Save you money!
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the money. Like most of these "no fog" mirrors - its fogs. It doesn't fog for the first few minutes in the shower. But if you shave last as I do, then by the time you do, it's all fogged up. If this were ~$10 instead of ~$30 then maybe. As is, I feel like I should have just flushed my money down the toilet....which I basically did.
customer_reviews.author: Atlanta PA Mom

customer_reviews.title: Positive Attachment No Worries
customer_reviews.text: I mounted the mirror high on my shower wall to gather light for me to see so it's a bit above my head. At this position it is absolutely fog free: I do not have to wipe the face as one might if it is splattered by the shower. Love the positive attachment to my fiberglass shower wall. As my eyes are getting worse (i'm 64) I could have opted for the 3X mirror but I'll wait a bit
customer_reviews.author: PC

customer_reviews.title: Great find!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mirrior, especially for the money. I had a less expensive (El Cheapo) fogless mirrior that would fog up if I even thought about taking a shower. The mirror also "stays put" when mounted correctly! My wife loves the mirror as well, altgough if she is shaving in the shower, I may have been hasty in asking her to marry me without my glasses on.
customer_reviews.author: Starfleet Dad

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking mirror.
customer_reviews.text: Mirror looks good and worked fine for the first few weeks but now constantly fogs up when the hot shower water is running. It can be wiped clean but it is an inconvenience. I was not surprised though as I have experienced similar issues with other bathroom mirrors in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My shower surface did not allow direct attachment so I ...
customer_reviews.text: My shower surface did not allow direct attachment so I ordered this product with the silicone and smooth plastic circle enclosed to adhere the mirror to my shower wall. The product worked as advertised and has been attached for over 2 weeks so far. The only thing I would change for my personal taste is to go down a magnification to a 2.

customer_reviews.title: sticks out way far from wall
